message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.MA 

The paper deals with regret bounds for bandit problems, which are a common topic in machine learning and optimization. Specifically, the paper focuses on path-length bounds, which are a measure of the variation of the losses. This is a topic that is closely related to online learning and optimization, which are typically covered in the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper discusses algorithms and techniques for bandit problems, which are also relevant to the data structures (cs.DS) and information theory (cs.IT) sub-categories. Finally, the paper specifically deals with multi-armed bandit problems, which are a type of reinforcement learning problem, and as such, the paper is also relevant to the multi-agent systems (cs.MA) sub-category.
